Zakat becomes obligatory when an individual owns a specific amount of silver for over a full Islamic lunar year (hawl).

Muslims are required to pay zakat on silver when they meet the following criteria:
• Amount: The amount of silver owned must be at least the nisab, which is the minimum amount of wealth that must be owned before paying zakat. The nisab for silver is 612.36 grams.
• Time: The silver must have been owned for at least one lunar year (hawl).
• Type: Silver used for everyday jewelry is not subject to zakat, unless it exceeds reasonable limits.
Zakat can be paid in cash or kind. You can also spread out your Zakat payments over the course of a year. To do this, calculate how much Zakat you owe for the year and divide that amount by 12.

Muslims are required to pay zakat on gold when they meet the following criteria:
• Amount: The amount of gold owned must be at least the nisab, which is the minimum amount of wealth that must be owned before paying zakat. The nisab for gold is 87.48 grams, or 3 ounces.
• Time: The gold must have been owned for at least one lunar year (hawl).
• Type: The gold must be pure 24-karat gold, and it must be kept as an investment or savings. Gold used for everyday jewelry is not subject to zakat, unless it exceeds reasonable limits.

Zakat al-Fitr is a charity that is obligatory on every Muslim at the end of the month of Ramadan. It is a small amount of food or its equivalent in money, and it is given to the poor and needy.

Zakat al-Fitr can be paid in the form of staple food, such as rice, wheat, or dates. It can also be paid in cash. The amount of Zakat al-Fitr is equivalent to one sa’ (approximately 2.5 kg) of staple food.

Also known as zakat profession, this zakat is paid on income earned from work or a profession. It can be paid monthly or accumulated and paid at the end of the year. The amount paid is up to 2.5% of total net income.

Yes, you may need to pay zakat on your income if it meets certain requirements:

- Income threshold: Your income must meet the nisab, which is the value of 85 grams of gold. The nisab is adjusted based on the current price of gold.

- Time: You must pay zakat after an Islamic lunar year (hawl) has passed, or if you've accumulated your income in a lump sum.

- Ownership: You must be the sole owner of the wealth and be able to spend or dispose of it as you like.

- Debt: You must pay or account for your current debts and essential living expenses. If what remains is above the nisab, then you must pay zakat.

Zakat is a religious obligation for Muslims to donate a portion of their wealth to charitable causes. The word zakat literally means purification. It is one of the Five Pillars of Islam and is essential for self-purification and helping others.

Zakat is meant to purify Muslims\' property and soul from faults like greed, stinginess, and meanness. It can help reduce poverty, build social harmony, and encourage generosity. Muslims believe that paying zakat purifies, increases, and blesses their remaining wealth.
Muslims who meet the following criteria are required to pay zakat:
- Sound mind: The person must be of sound mind and not have a disturbed mental condition.
- Baligh: The person must have reached the age of puberty, which is marked by dreams for men and menstruation for women.
- Wealth reaches Nisab: The person\'s wealth must reach the predetermined minimum limit, known as the Nisab.
- Assets reach Hawl: The person\'s wealth must have reached the age of one Islamic year, as adjusted to the Hijri calendar.
Zakat is given to the poor, travelers in need, and other designated groups of people.
There are two main categories of Zakat, namely:

Zakat fitrah is a charitable donation of food that Muslims are required to pay during the month of Ramadan and before the Eid prayer on 1 Shawwal. It is a mandatory annual payment for every Muslim, regardless of age, gender, or wealth.

Zakat al-mal, commonly referred to as zakat on wealth or alms-giving, is paid on money, gold, and other valuable assets. Zakat al-mal is calculated as 2.5% of an individual\'s wealth. Assets that have been owned for one Islamic year (hawl) are subject to zakat al-mal.
The dua to say when paying zakat means: O Allah, make it a gain and do not make it a loss. This is said by the Messenger of Allah, as narrated by Abu Hurayrah.

It is mandatory to make an intention to give zakat, either when organizing the payment or when making the payment. If a donation is made without the intention of zakat, it will not be counted as zakat.
